column1: This article discusses the effects of swallowing a large amount of baking powder.
If the person can swallow, give them water or milk right away, unless a provider tells you not to.
DO NOT give water or milk if the person has symptoms that make it hard to swallow.
The person may receive: - Blood and urine tests - EKG (electrocardiogram or heart tracing) - Intravenous fluids (through a vein) - Medicines to treat symptoms
